Mr Ravell has over 25 years' experience in the financial services industry. He is a Representative Director and the Responsible Manager of NW Advice Pty Ltd and Wealth Focus Pty Ltd, and is responsible for providing advice to clients, principally focused on strategy and asset allocation. He was previously a member of the Filtered Research Committee, a service aimed at avoiding product failures and assisting adviser groups in constructing

Mr Miller has a Diploma of Financial Advising and 30 years of broad experience in financial markets.

Director (2011 to April 2020) and Responsible Officer of Miller Wealth Management Pty Ltd which held an Australian Financial Services License from 2011 to 2020. He was previously a partner in a Brisbane based financial planning firm and a member of the investment committee of an ASX listed financial services group. Mr Miller is also experienced in commercial property investment, development finance and property development.

elements.title: Financial Reporting Entity and Significant Accounting Policies
Financial assets, liabilities and dividend provisions

data.value: Financial assets are derecognised when the rights to receive cash flows from the financial assets have expired or have been transferred.
Investments at fair value through profit or loss are either held for trading or designated as upon initial recognition.
Loans are financial assets initially recognised at fair value plus directly attributable transaction costs.
An assessment is made for expected credit losses impacting future cash flows.
A profit reserve has been created for future dividend payments.
Provision is made for declared dividends on fully paid ordinary shares.
Management must make judgements, estimates, and assumptions for financial statements.

elements.title: Fair value measurement hierarchy and allowances for expected credit losses

data.value: The Company classifies all assets and liabilities measured at fair value using a three-level hierarchy: Level 1: Quoted prices in active markets; Level 2: Observable inputs other than quoted prices; Level 3: Unobservable inputs.
The assessment requires estimation and judgement, based on lifetime expected credit loss grouped by overdue days, impacted by factors like recent sales experience and COVID-19.
Recognised for deductible temporary differences only if future taxable amounts are probable to utilise those differences.
Judgements on potential impacts revealed no significant operational or financial effects during the reported year.
The Company operates in a single financial services segment and only in Australia.
